intro: Lavoisiera francavillana, commonly known as the Frenchville lavoisiera, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern France. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, characterized by its succulent stems and basal leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
